page.title: 09Veterinary Investigation
page.content: At Polwhele there is a{Veterinary {Investigation Centre.}It is managed by the{Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries {& Food.}The main purpose of the Centre is to keep a check on animal diseases that occur in Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly. It is the only one of its kind in Cornwall and at the present time the Ministry wishes to close it. It is chiefly a laboratory, operating as a service to Veterinary Surgeons, testing samples from diseased animals and carrying out post-mortems, in order to diagnose diseases. It mostly deals with farm animals but wildlife, such as badgers, are also checked for diseases that might spread to healthy animals. The Centre employs 14 civil servants, i.e. 3 veterinary surgeons, 2 clerical staff and 9 laboratory technicians.
